    • \NoBannerLogger

    Extends DefaultLogger to strip out empty targets.

    @author Andreas Aderhold andi@binarycloud.com

    copyright 2001,2002 THYRELL. All rights reserved @version $Id$ @package phing.listener
    author Andreas Aderhold <andi@binarycloud.com> @copyright 2001,2002 THYRELL. All rights reserved @version $Id$ @see BuildEvent @package phing.listener

    Set the msgOutputLevel this logger is to respond to.

    setMessageOutputLevel(int $level) 
    Inherited

    Only messages with a message level lower than or equal to the given level are output to the log.

    <

    p> Constants for the message levels are in Project.php. The order of the levels, from least to most verbose, is:

    • Project::MSG_ERR
    • Project::MSG_WARN
    • Project::MSG_INFO
    • Project::MSG_VERBOSE
    • Project::MSG_DEBUG

    The default message level for DefaultLogger is Project::MSG_ERR.

    see \global\BuildLogger#setMessageOutputLevel()
    inherited_from \DefaultLogger::setMessageOutputLevel()

    Parameters

    $level

    int

    The logging level for the logger.

    Inherited
    inherited_from \DefaultLogger::printMessage()

    Parameters

    $message

    string

    The message to print. Should not be null.

    $stream

    resource

    The stream to use for message printing.

    $priority

    int

    The priority of the message. (Ignored in this implementation.)
